name: places/ChIJx7gWdoNYwokREYV9d-wtUkE
formattedAddress: 580 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA
adrFormatAddress: 580 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10024-2302, USA

originalText.text: Amara Strings was a dream to work with. I worked with them throughout the wedding planning process to figure out our musical choices for the ceremony, and they were extremely accommodating when I had two musical requests that were not in their repertoire. They learned the music, and had it perfectly prepared for my wedding day. And then the weather forecast came out. It was forecast for rain and thunderstorms all day on our wedding day. Our wedding ceremony took place outside in central park, and our rain plan relied on 40 clear umbrellas for our guests. Because they play string instruments, they (obviously) do not play during rainstorms, and we were all disappointed that they would not be able to play at my ceremony, after all the work they had put in. And then they engineered a miracle. Jen, who I worked with throughout the process, proposed having the musicians record the music in a studio before the ceremony and use a speaker to play the music at the ceremony. She executed a miracle by hiring the musicians and getting the studio space last minute. They recorded the music the morning of the wedding day, and we played it at the ceremony that afternoon. It was beyond my wildest dreams amazing. That is a long winded way to say that you could not find better, more dedicated group of musicians to work with. They are brilliantly talented, and incredibly dedicated. Work with them. Our collaboration was one of the best parts of the wedding process and day.
